com.inrix.sdk.utils

Class InrixDateUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inrix.sdk.utils.InrixDateUtils

  • public final class InrixDateUtils
extends Object
    Contains static methods for converting dates to and from formatted strings.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String INRIX_DATE_FORMAT
      The INRIX date format, using default time zone.
      static String INRIX_DATE_FORMAT_FRACTIONAL_SECONDS
      The INRIX date format, including fractional seconds.

    • Method Detail

      • getDateFromString

        public static Date getDateFromString(String str)
                              throws ParseException
        Parses the date as a string and returns the date object. The String must be in the following format: "yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss\'Z\'". The time zone is UTC.
        Parameters:
        str - The date as a string in INRIX time format.
        Returns:
        The converted date.
        Throws:
        ParseException - when str is not in the correct format.

      • getDateFromString

        public static Date getDateFromString(String str,
                     boolean fractionalSeconds)
                              throws ParseException
        Parses the date as a string and returns the date object. The String must be in INRIX time format: "yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss\'Z\'" or "yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss.SSS\'Z\'". The time zone is UTC.
        Parameters:
        str - The date as a string in INRIX time format.
        fractionalSeconds - Whether the string includes fractional seconds or not.
        Returns:
        The converted date.
        Throws:
        ParseException - when str is not in the correct format.

      • getStringFromDateUtc

        public static String getStringFromDateUtc(Date date)
        Converts the specified UTC date to an INRIX time format string. This format is required for INRIX server requests.
        Parameters:
        date - The UTC date to be converted.
        Returns:
        The date formatted as "yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss\'Z\'", or null if date is null.

      • getStringFromDateUtc

        public static String getStringFromDateUtc(Date date,
                          boolean fractionalSeconds)
        Converts the specified UTC date to an INRIX time format string. This format is required for INRIX server requests.
        Parameters:
        date - The UTC date to be converted.
        fractionalSeconds - Whether the string should include fractional seconds or not.
        Returns:
        The date formatted as "yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss\'Z\'" or "yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss.SSS\'Z\'", or null if date is null.

      • roundUp

        public static Date roundUp(Date date,
           int offset)
        Round up specified date to the nearest value.
        Parameters:
        date - Target date.
        offset - Nearest offset.
        Returns:
        New date value.

      • round

        public static Date round(Date date,
         int offsetMinute)
        Round the specified date to the nearest minute offset.
        Parameters:
        date - Target date.
        offsetMinute - Nearest minute offset.
        Returns:
        New date value.

      • getNowAsUtc

        public static Calendar getNowAsUtc()
        Utility method which returns the current local time (on the device) as timezone "UTC" useful for when dealing with Schedules.
        Returns:
        The current local time with UTC timezone.

      • convertDateToSOD

        public static Date convertDateToSOD(Date date)
        Convert date to the start of a day.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to convert.
        Returns:
        A date representing the start of a day

      • convertDateToEOD

        public static Date convertDateToEOD(Date date)
        Convert date to the end of a day.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to convert.
        Returns:
        A date representing the end of a day

      • getDayOffset

        public static int getDayOffset(Date start,
               Date end)
        Get the offset between two dates in days.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting date to evaluate.
        end - The ending date to evaluate.
        Returns:
        The days offset.

      • getEncompassingDates

        public static List<Date> getEncompassingDates(Date start,
                              Date end)
        Gets the list of dates that are included in the given range.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting date to evaluate.
        end - The ending date to evaluate.
        Returns:
        A list of dates in the date range.

      • isSameDay

        public static boolean isSameDay(Date date1,
                Date date2)
        Compares to see if two dates fall on the same day, irrespective of locale.
        Parameters:
        date1 - Date to be compared.
        date2 - Date to be compared to.
        Returns:
        true if both dates fall on same day, false otherwise.
